citation.article-title: Lactobacillus bobalius sp. nov., a lactic acid bacterium isolated from Spanish Bobal grape must.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus bobalius sp. nov.
Lactobacillus bobalius (bo.ba′li.us. N.L. masc. adj. bobalius pertaining to the grape variety Bobal).
Cells are Gram-positive, non-motile, non-spore-forming rods, 0.71–1.03 μm wide and 1.65–3.41 μm long.
Cells are found singly, in pairs and in short chains.
Colonies on MRS agar after 4 days incubation at 28 °C are 1.8–2.0 mm in diameter, smooth, circular to slightly irregular and white.
Facultatively heterofermentative; no gas is produced from glucose.
dl-Lactate is produced as an end product from hexoses and pentoses.
Ammonia is not produced from arginine and mannitol is not produced from fructose.
Dextran is not produced from sucrose.
Citric and malic acids are used.

Ferments ribose, glucose, fructose, mannose, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, sucrose, trehalose, melezitose, β-gentiobiose and gluconate and hydrolyses aesculin.

Does not ferment glycerol, erythritol, d- or l-arabinose, d- or l-xylose, adonitol, methyl β-xyloside, galactose, l-sorbose, rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, lactose, melibiose, inulin, raffinose, starch, glycogen, xylitol, turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d- or l-fucose, d- or l-arabitol or 2- or 5-ketogluconate.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 34.03±0.77 mol%.
The cell wall contains peptidoglycan of the A4α l-Lys–d-Asp type.
The type strain, 203T (=CECT 7310T =DSM 19674T), was isolated in 1997 by one of the authors (A. M. R.) from a Bobal grape must.
